required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Histamine H1/H2 Receptors and Training Adaptations
clinical_study.official_title: Role of Histamine H1/H2 Receptors in the Health- and Performance-promoting Adaptations to High-intensity Interval Training

brief_summary.textblock: Exercise training is beneficial for both health and performance. Histamine has been shown to be involved in the acute exercise response. The current study addresses the role of histamine H1/H2 receptor signaling in the chronic training-induced adaptations. Results from this study will yield more insights into the molecular mechanisms of adaptations to exercise training.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Placebo + exercise vs histamine blockade + exercise
study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.time_frame: Before, after 3 weeks and after 6 weeks of exercise training
primary_outcome.description: Change in maximal oxygen uptake during incremental cycling test on cycle ergometer during the 6 week training period

primary_outcome.measure: Change in peak aerobic power output
primary_outcome.time_frame: Before, after 3 weeks and after 6 weeks of exercise training
primary_outcome.description: Change in peak power output during incremental cycling test on cycle ergometer during the 6 week training period

primary_outcome.time_frame: Before and after 6 weeks of exercise training
primary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in Matsuda index for whole-body insulin sensitivity derived from Oral Glucose Tolerance Test after the 6 week training period

primary_outcome.time_frame: Before and after 6 weeks of exercise training
primary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in microvascular function (Single Passive Leg Movement technique) after the 6 week training period

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Before and after 6 weeks of exercise training
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in skeletal muscle capillarization (immunohistochemistry) after the 6 week training period

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in skeletal muscle enzyme activity
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Before and after 6 weeks of exercise training
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in enzyme activity assessment of markers of relevance for skeletal muscle function after the 6 week training period

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in skeletal muscle protein content
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Before and after 6 weeks of exercise training
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in Western Blot assessment of markers of relevance for skeletal muscle function after the 6 week training period

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in power output at Gas Exchange Threshold (GET)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Before, after 3 weeks and after 6 weeks of exercise training
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in GET during incremental cycling test after the 6 week training period

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in power output at Respiratory Compensation Point (RCP)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Before, after 3 weeks and after 6 weeks of exercise training
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in RCP during incremental cycling test after the 6 week training period

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in time to exhaustion performance test
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Before, after 3 weeks and after 6 weeks of exercise training
secondary_outcome.description: Change in time to exhaustion test (performed after incremental cycling test) during the 6 week training period

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in heart rate during submaximal cycling
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Before and after 6 weeks of exercise training
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in heart rate during submaximal cycling after the 6 week training period

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in substrate oxidation during submaximal cycling
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Before and after 6 weeks of exercise training
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in substrate oxidation during submaximal cycling test (estimated via gas exchange data) after the 6 week training period

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in blood lactate accumulation during submaximal cycling
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Before and after 6 weeks of exercise training
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in capillary lactate concentration at end of submaximal cycling test after the 6 week training period

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in cycling efficiency during submaximal cycling
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Before and after 6 weeks of exercise training
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in cycling efficiency (estimated via gas exchange data) after the 6 week training period

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in fasted serum insulin concentrations
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Before and after 6 weeks of exercise training
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in fasted blood concentrations of insulin after the 6 week training period

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in fasted serum glucose concentrations
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Before and after 6 weeks of exercise training
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in fasted blood concentrations of glucose after the 6 week training period

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in fasted serum cholesterol concentrations
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Before and after 6 weeks of exercise training
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in fasted blood concentrations of cholesterol after the 6 week training period

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in fasted serum triglyceride concentrations
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Before and after 6 weeks of exercise training
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in fasted blood concentrations of triglyceride after the 6 week training period

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Before and after 6 weeks of exercise training
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in resting mean arterial blood pressure after the 6 week training period

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Before and after 6 weeks of exercise training
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in resting heart rate after the 6 week training period

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Before and after 6 weeks of exercise training
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in total body weight after the 6 week training period

arm_group.description: 6 weeks high-intensity interval training + placebo intake
6 weeks high-intensity interval training + histamine H1/H2 receptor blockade

intervention.description: H1 receptor antagonist: 540 mg Fexofenadine Hydrochloride

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Sedentary or low levels of physical activity
- Caucasian
Exclusion Criteria:
- Chronic diseases
- Medication use
- Smoking
- Excessive alcohol consumption
- Seasonal allergies

facility.name: Department of Movement and Sports Sciences, Ghent University
